result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:05 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Carrie M Kopplin in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Carrie M Kopplin.   Prosecuting attorney Theresa A Beck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Nelson requests another STC to allow additional time with her client relating to discovery and settlement. 
Case continued for STC - 11/10/2022 at 2:30pm. 
Recess 2:06pm

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
STC - 11/10/2022 at 2:30pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:35am 
Defendant Carrie M Kopplin in court, in custody with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
The Court reviews the court record.
 
Deputy Vanessa Leonard-sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson

The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Kopplin committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 
recess: 8:50am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/27/22 at 10:40am (2) Status Conference on 9/16/22 at 2:00pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Carrie M Kopplin
Current: 1000 S. Main St. #206, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 1000 S Main St. Apt #20, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[ma] Case called at 1:26pm 
Defendant Carrie M Kopplin appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; updates address to: Apt #206
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2
--no presence at Orchard View Adult Family Home 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

recess 1:30 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/22/22 at 1:00pm   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 7/12/22 at 8:30am
